page.title: 01BLOCK 02440105 SUMMARY
page.content: The block consists mostly of pastoral farmland interspersed by streams and woods. The River Torridge flows through the centre from west to east. To the north and south the land slopes down to the river's flood plain. Above and to the south stands the village of Black Torrington with St Mary's Church ,Hope Chapel, school,public hall, inn, playing field, surgery, general store and sub-post office, a few business premises and housing for the two hundred inhabitants. The main street, lined by houses and terraced cottages, leads to the church, while side roads complete two rectangles to the east. Adults follow a variety of occupations , half outside the village, while 25% of residents are retired. One kilometre to the north west stands Coham House, the ancestral home of the Coham-Fleming family, set in woodland.
